page.title: 12SUNDAY IN ELLINGTON
page.content: The family have a short lie in on Sunday. They get up at 8.00am and have breakfast at about 8.15am.They have Alpen or Cornflakes. They don't have Sunday papers delivered but they go out to buy them when they have been to church.They have to travel to church because there is no Roman Catholic church in Ellington. The papers they buy are the Sun and The Mirror. They don't have a traditional Sunday lunch. instead they have a salad or sandwiches. Mr and Mrs Beaumont usually have a beer to drink. On Sunday afternoon they do the gardening. Then they have tea. They watch the television in the evening and then they go to bed. Lee goes to bed at 8.00pm and his parents go at 11.00pm.
